title: Dramatic Writing (Film, Television, and Theatre I) (52.09200) (2018)
subject: CTAE (2013-)

0C14021BCCC548DDB94E251CF0291743.description:
Present a professional image through appearance, behavior, and language, i.e., on-the-job
etiquette, person-to-person etiquette, communication etiquette, presenting yourself

33C0000532AC4D5BBDAD8BD3FE7BFD5A.description:
Apply the appropriate skill sets to be productive in a changing, technological, diverse
workplace to be able to work independently and apply teamwork skills, i.e., expected
work traits, teamwork, time management.

99DB593067794F45A4FFC3FEA88890C9.description:
Model work readiness traits required for success in the workplace including integrity,
honesty, accountability, punctuality, time management, and respect for diversity, i.e.,
workplace ethics, personal characteristics, employer expectations, business etiquette,
communicating at work.

CAE86B18DBDC4E31A6B83C9EF793B0B4.description:
Exhibit critical thinking and problem solving skills to locate, analyze, and apply
information in career planning and employment situations, i.e., problem solving,
customer service, application process, interviewing skills, job searching.

9D7E60367674450B8B1E34E7D8532F01.description:
Demonstrate creativity by asking challenging questions and applying innovative
procedures and methods, i.e., teamwork, problem solving, etiquette.

9712F9CC93EE41B997AF24BE7959BF25.description:
Demonstrate employability skills required by business and industry, i.e., communicate
effectively through writing, speaking, listening, reading, and interpersonal abilities.

0CEF3802B647438E8632EBCEAAD498D4.description:
Examine and apply theories, performances, and conventions from a variety of films,
television, and theatre scripts from historical periods, and cultures.

F9E271B0A8694F62AE920D44D5145F1E.description: Examine the role of film in a societal, cultural, and historical contexts.

62871B83927E49648C7D0BF80E66D2B9.description:
Recognize the unique contributions of contemporary and/or historical artists and art
forms, including Georgia artists.

1EFB7E49CAE643A5B06E075FEF00C01A.description:
Examine and demonstrate the methods of pursuing various entertainment writing careers
including submission techniques

2CF06A9772F8439781387FFCEFC0A311.description: Examine multiple facets of the business of film, television and theatre.

7EEB2DC8485E4299BB14E037BFF0091C.description:
Explore how writing for film, television, and theatre connects to careers
and the entertainment industry.

4D494277A5F94871B37629137EE27670.description:
Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision)
and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes,
and audiences.

2C9EF0038BBE4FBAAFB497013BF5A356.description:
Draw evidence from a variety of literary or informational texts of varying lengths and
complexity to support analysis, reflection, and research.

F140D58C03814345B6CCB2A45A187E03.description:
Gather relevant information from multiple authoritative print and digital sources, using
advanced searches effectively; assess the usefulness of each source, answering the
research question; integrate information into the text selectively to maintain the flow of
ideas, avoid plagiarism and follow a standard format for citation

561331FBBA124A49BD3471EB53666DBC.description:
Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects to answer a question (including
a self-generated question) or solve a problem; narrow or broaden the inquiry when
appropriate; synthesize multiple sources on the subject, demonstrating understanding of
the subject under investigation

234C3E840AF14A12AB5870DE78D3FC68.description:
Identify the elements, influences, and contributions of other art forms and content areas
to theatre literature

56DC22498A204B2CB1518B7106BC4812.description:
Research and explain how cultural and historical factors have influenced playwrights and
theatre literature.

006A6ABB1A96473E9ED64C8C0C04F98D.description:
Identify and summarize contributions made to the development of theatre literature by
different cultures and traditions.

365D89A76A8241EC904CE614D0BC96A4.description: Trace the development of theatre from earliest forms to contemporary forms

120C968EA5764045A93AD122A8A13337.description:
Connect film, television, and theatre literature to its dramaturgical contexts
and other disciplines

7BFFE8009E774AA0AF7161FE49FCBC9E.description:
Analyze how an author draws on and transforms source material in a specific work (e.g.,
how Shakespeare treats a theme or topic from Ovid or the Bible or how a later author
draws on a play by Shakespeare).

5C7D2B28A40743538F1F44071B5B7237.description:
Analyze the representation of a subject or a key scene in two or three different artistic
mediums (e.g., the play The Boys Next Door and the movie “It’s a Wonderful Life” and
the television show “My So Called Life”), including what is emphasized or absent in
each treatment.

6E0C4F08973542EBA0CA14396093006D.description:
Analyze a particular point of view or cultural experience reflected in a work of literature
from outside the United States, drawing on a wide reading of world literature.

52F9FC88D3DD47DFB845DAFB72FF6631.description:
Analyze how an author’s choices concerning how to structure a text, order events within
it (e.g., parallel plots), and manipulate time (e.g., pacing, flashbacks) create such effects
as mystery, tension, or surprise.

51BE4B1B9ECE4D6EA2B1C7C845F0F40D.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in the text, including
figurative and connotative meanings; analyze the cumulative impact of specific word
choices on meaning and tone (e.g., how the language evokes a sense of time and place;
how it sets a formal or informal tone.)

DAAED3B499964ECBAF909F44BDEFE489.description: Compare and contrast theatre texts to live/film performance.

091007C9024249FBA033BF4C04D34FA7.description: Develop and apply a set of comprehensive criteria for theatre text analysis.

1D765666F2C04104A6707E8907298906.description:
Compare and summarize theatre literature from various historical periods, cultures, and
styles.

73DE84304FAD4F76A4F347EB935B1547.description:
Evaluate various aspects of dramatic arts literature using appropriate
supporting evidence.

20CD90B264DB4D1C8A690B39A0A98589.description:
Evaluate and/or reflect on a speaker’s point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and
rhetoric

C83FC87765D746D2B6356E663CAF07C4.description:
Integrate multiple sources of information presented in diverse media or formats (e.g.,
visually, quantitatively, orally) evaluating the credibility and accuracy of each source

42B801C1D83347D0A09C13B7DA9EEDA0.description:
Use performance (e.g., oration, improvisation, rehearsed monologues, scenes) to analyze
a character’s role and significance to the meaning of the play

A6B8EF98FD3A41EFABD8FF68C5A2F9D4.description:
Analyze and create characters in dramatic arts literature from the
perspective of an actor/performer.

75D832E6527147DFBE8449BCF58AA1C8.description:
Use technology, including the Internet, to produce, publish, and update individual or
shared writing products, taking advantage of technology’s capacity to link to other
information and to display information flexibly and dynamically

23EF5889867B4B55B5EDDD1BE0868F7B.description:
Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or
trying a new approach, focusing on addressing what is most significant for a specific
purpose and audience

ED5211D008A444B2B50F619A370E5A3C.description:
Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are
appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

96CCDAB5734A4135B9675EC91E6C7BF2.description:
Use precise words and phrases, telling details, and sensory language to convey a vivid
picture of the experiences, events, setting, and/or characters.

59B2589392E9409193AE7BB7C5FB2888.description:
Use a variety of techniques to sequence events so that they build on one another to create
a coherent whole.

8BB48F5FF6094D38A9506F5CD9BA55C5.description: Establish and maintain an appropriate style and objective tone.

BD83092455A84C6881AB6F0C44415F3F.description:
Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to manage the complexity of the
topic

9DB52A21804C4E81BBEB00AB4993D8D4.description:
Use appropriate and varied transitions to link the major sections of the text, create
cohesion, and clarify the relationships among complex ideas and concepts

6510E38CF393421C9B6AF523BE494C23.description:
Develop the topic with well-chosen, relevant, and sufficient facts, extended definitions,
concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples appropriate to the
audience’s knowledge of the topic

781572DDE76B4AD7B6C4B34A9A5C3DBA.description:
Use words, phrases, and clauses to link the major sections of the text, create cohesion,
and clarify the relationships between claim(s) and reasons, between reasons and
evidence, and between claim(s) and counterclaims

73A895BD74F14B5081E9B0E6927F7AF1.description:
Develop claim(s) and counterclaims fairly, supplying evidence for each while pointing
out the strengths and limitations of both in a manner that anticipates the audience’s
knowledge level and concerns

2B29206AFB4942B3BEA239A5AEC55D1B.description:
Develop original texts using theatre techniques (e.g. improvisation, adapting non-theatre
literature, playwriting exercises).

461737A520C2480EBC9B401F4E7993C7.description: Examine and outline the steps and conventions involved in the creation of a theatre text

5B2A8710DDB844269C9394BC97DB6807.description:
Produce clear and concise writing that includes the conventions of standard
English grammar and usage.

5D59D3E3254341E7AAFAD715592F57BA.description:
Make strategic use of digital media (e.g., textual, graphical, audio, visual, and interactive
elements) in presentations to enhance understanding of findings, reasoning, and evidence
and to add interest.

CDAE5E838609423DA1C7C518512BD019.description:
Present information, findings, and supporting evidence clearly, concisely, and logically
such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development,
substance, and style are appropriate to purpose, audience, and task.

9E0001D3E14446A8AF89A0FE92D371E7.description:
Differentiate between dramatic and traditional literary writing and utilize common steps
of the playwriting process.

AD5C7F50CD6A4836B6AC62C19C7F4635.description:
Provide a conclusion that follows from and reflects on what is experienced, observed, or
resolved over the course of the narrative

50065D025FA24330B14CAB5342CC1E19.description:
Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, description, reflection, and multiple
plot lines, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters.

2F8CF545020E4C03ACF5CA2A0C4C01EE.description: Establish and maintain an appropriate style and objective tone

39450B3455404A80ACA3EDC0C544CF64.description:
Engage and orient the reader by setting out a problem, situation, or observation,
establishing one or multiple point(s) of view, and introducing a narrator and/or
characters; create a smooth progression of experiences or events.

A77CE8F03CB4405EA74091078ABB3CF6.description:
Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective
technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences.

9900E6A8DBBB4169A1EB4251AD26F57C.description:
Write original dramatic arts literature for film, television, or theatre that
convey a real or imagined experience.
